definitions: three-dimensional shape with circular base tapering to a point
woody seed-bearing structure found on pine and fir trees
bright orange plastic marker used to direct traffic or mark boundaries
crisp edible wafer shaped into a point for holding ice cream
examples: The geometry teacher drew a perfect cone on the board
Calculate the volume of a cone with these measurements
Pine cones littered the forest floor beneath the trees
She collected cones to make holiday decorations
Orange traffic cones blocked the damaged lane
Soccer practice used cones to mark the drill boundaries
The children each ordered double-scoop ice cream cones
Would you prefer a cone or a cup for your ice cream

definitions: sweet food made with sugar, often including chocolate, nuts, or fruit
elaborate or delicate creation, especially in clothing or decorative arts
examples: The pastry chef created beautiful confections for the wedding
Chocolate truffles are her favorite confection to make
The designer's latest confection featured layers of silk and lace
Her hat was an elaborate confection of feathers and ribbons

definitions: person who makes or sells candies, chocolates, and other sweet treats professionally
examples: The confectioner worked all night preparing Valentine's Day chocolates
She apprenticed with a master confectioner in Switzerland

definitions: candies, chocolates, and other sweet foods considered collectively as a category
shop or business where confections are made or sold commercially
examples: The store specialized in imported confectionery from Europe
Children pressed their noses against the confectionery display case
Her family owned a small confectionery on Main Street
The confectionery produced handmade chocolates for fifty years

definitions: alliance or league of states, groups, or people united for a common purpose
group of people joined together for an unlawful or secret purpose
examples: The confederacy of tribes fought against colonial expansion
Several states formed a confederacy to oppose the new laws
Police uncovered a confederacy planning to smuggle stolen goods
The confederacy of thieves operated across three counties

definitions: person, state, or group joined with others in a political or military alliance
person who assists someone in carrying out a plan, especially something illegal
examples: The confederates met to discuss their mutual defense treaty
Each confederate nation contributed troops to the alliance
The thief's confederate waited outside in the getaway car
Police arrested him and his confederates in the fraud scheme

definitions: organization or alliance of different groups, states, or parties united for mutual support or action
examples: The confederation of labor unions organized a nationwide strike
Switzerland is officially known as the Swiss Confederation

definitions: formal statement admitting guilt, wrongdoing, or responsibility for something
religious practice of telling sins to a priest to receive forgiveness
intimate admission or disclosure of personal thoughts, feelings, or secrets
examples: The suspect signed a confession after hours of questioning
His confession included details only the perpetrator would know
She went to confession every Saturday before evening Mass
The priest heard confessions in the small wooden booth
Her memoir reads like a confession of past mistakes
In a tearful confession, he admitted his true feelings

definitions: small enclosed booth in a church where priests hear confessions
type of writing or media that reveals intimate personal details
examples: The old wooden confessional stood in the corner of the church
She entered the confessional and knelt on the worn cushion
Her latest book is a confessional about her troubled childhood
The documentary took a confessional approach to addiction

definitions: priest authorized to hear confessions and grant absolution in the Catholic Church
person who suffered for their religious faith but was not martyred
examples: Father Michael served as confessor to the royal family
She always requested the same confessor for spiritual guidance
Saint Edward the Confessor ruled England before the Norman Conquest
The confessor endured imprisonment but kept his faith

definitions: small pieces of colored paper thrown during celebrations, weddings, or parades
examples: Confetti rained down as the bride and groom left the church
The parade cleanup crew swept pounds of confetti from the streets

definitions: trusted male friend with whom one shares personal matters and secrets
examples: His brother had always been his closest confidant
The president relied on his confidant for honest advice

definitions: trusted female friend with whom one shares personal matters and secrets
examples: She considered her sister her most trusted confidante
The actress and her confidante had been friends since childhood

definitions: ethical and legal principle of keeping sensitive information private and protected from unauthorized disclosure
examples: Doctor-patient confidentiality prevents sharing of medical records
The company required all employees to sign confidentiality agreements

definitions: particular arrangement or pattern of parts, elements, or components in a system
way computer hardware or software is set up or arranged to function
examples: The configuration of the molecules determines the compound's properties
They tested different seating configurations for the conference room
The network configuration needed updating for better security
Check your email configuration settings if messages aren't sending

definitions: state of being imprisoned, restricted, or kept within certain limits or boundaries
period before and during childbirth when a woman rests and prepares
examples: His confinement to a small cell lasted for three years
The prisoner protested against solitary confinement conditions
The duchess began her confinement two weeks before delivery
Women traditionally observed a month of confinement after childbirth

definitions: action of confirming something is true, accurate, or valid through evidence or authority
Christian ceremony admitting baptized person to full church membership
examples: Email confirmation of your order will arrive within minutes
The lab results provided confirmation of the initial diagnosis
Her confirmation ceremony took place on Palm Sunday
The bishop performed confirmations for twenty young people

definitions: act of taking someone's property with authority, especially as a penalty or for legal reasons
examples: The confiscation of illegal weapons reduced neighborhood crime
Customs ordered confiscation of the undeclared merchandise

definitions: extensive fire that destroys a great deal of land or property
examples: The conflagration destroyed three city blocks before firefighters contained it
Historical records describe the great conflagration of 1666 in London

definitions: point where two or more rivers or streams flow together to form one
act or process of merging or flowing together of different things or ideas
examples: The town developed at the confluence of two major rivers
Fishing is excellent at the confluence where waters mix
The project succeeded through a confluence of talent and timing
A confluence of factors led to the economic crisis

definitions: act of complying with or meeting rules, standards, or laws
examples: The factory maintained strict conformance to safety regulations
Product conformance with industry standards ensures quality control

definitions: shape, structure, or arrangement of parts of something, especially in relation to function
action of conforming to or complying with conventions, rules, or standards
examples: The protein's conformation determines its biological activity
Judges evaluated each dog's conformation against breed standards
Their conformation to social norms helped them fit in
The school demanded strict conformation to its dress code

definitions: person who conforms to accepted behavior, practices, or standards without questioning
examples: He was too much of a conformist to challenge company policies
The 1950s produced a generation of suburban conformists

definitions: behavior that follows accepted standards, rules, or conventions of a group or society
state of matching or agreeing with something in form, nature, or character
examples: Social conformity pressures teenagers to dress like their peers
The company culture demanded conformity in appearance and behavior
The building design shows conformity with local architectural styles
Quality control checks conformity between products and specifications

definitions: hostile or argumentative meeting between opposing parties, ideas, or forces
examples: The confrontation between protesters and police lasted several hours
She avoided confrontation by agreeing with his demands

definitions: latin american dance performed by people in single file holding the person in front
tall narrow drum beaten with the hands in latin american music
examples: Wedding guests formed a conga line around the reception hall
The conga rhythm got everyone moving on the dance floor
He played the conga drums in a salsa band
The musician's conga skills added energy to the performance

definitions: condition of severe traffic buildup causing slow movement or complete stoppage
abnormal accumulation of blood or mucus in body parts causing blockage or discomfort
examples: Rush hour congestion added an hour to her commute
The city implemented tolls to reduce downtown congestion
Nasal congestion made it difficult for him to breathe
The medication helps relieve chest congestion from colds

definitions: large corporation formed by merging different companies engaged in unrelated business activities
coarse-grained sedimentary rock composed of rounded fragments cemented together
examples: The media conglomerate owned newspapers, TV stations, and websites
International conglomerates dominate many industries today
Geologists studied the ancient conglomerate formation in the canyon
The conglomerate contained pebbles from various rock types

definitions: collection or mixture of different things or people grouped together without order
examples: The flea market was a conglomeration of antiques and junk
A conglomeration of ideas emerged from the brainstorming session

definitions: central african country officially known as Democratic Republic of the Congo
major african river flowing through central africa to the Atlantic Ocean
afro-cuban dance and drumming style with distinctive rhythm patterns
examples: The Congo gained independence from Belgium in 1960
Mining companies operate extensively in the Congo's mineral-rich regions
The Congo River is the second longest river in Africa
Traders used the Congo as a major transportation route
The band played an energetic congo rhythm for dancers
Traditional congo drums provide the music's foundation

definitions: group of people assembled for religious worship, especially in Christian churches
gathering or collection of people, animals, or things in one place
examples: The congregation rose to sing the opening hymn together
Their congregation has worshipped in this building since 1850
A congregation of protesters filled the town square
Congregation of birds on the wire indicated approaching storms

definitions: female member elected to serve in a congress, especially the U.S. House of Representatives
examples: The congresswoman introduced legislation to improve healthcare access
She became the first congresswoman elected from her district

definitions: exact correspondence in size and shape between geometric figures
state of agreement, harmony, or compatibility between things
examples: The geometry teacher demonstrated congruence using overlapping triangles
Proving congruence requires showing all corresponding parts match
There was remarkable congruence between their independent research findings
The therapist noted congruence between his words and actions

definitions: tree that bears cones and needle-like or scale-like leaves, mostly evergreen
examples: Conifers like pine and spruce dominate northern forests
The nursery specialized in dwarf conifers for small gardens

definitions: opinion or conclusion formed on the basis of incomplete information without firm evidence
examples: His theory remained mere conjecture without experimental proof
Financial analysts offered conjecture about the market's future direction

definitions: variation of verb forms to express tense, mood, person, and number in grammar
temporary union of organisms, especially single cells, for exchanging genetic material
examples: Spanish conjugation changes verb endings for each pronoun
Students practiced conjugation of irregular verbs for homework
Bacterial conjugation allows genetic material transfer between cells
Scientists observed conjugation under the microscope

definitions: word used to connect clauses, sentences, or words like 'and', 'but', 'or'
occurrence of events or circumstances happening at the same time
examples: The conjunction 'but' shows contrast between two ideas
Remove unnecessary conjunctions to improve your writing style
The conjunction of favorable weather and timing ensured success
A rare conjunction of planets will be visible tonight

definitions: performance of tricks that appear magical, typically involving quick hand movements and misdirection
examples: His conjuring act amazed children at the birthday party
She studied conjuring techniques from famous magicians

definitions: word or phrase that connects parts of text or speech together logically
tissue that connects, supports, or surrounds other tissues and organs in the body
examples: The connective 'however' signals a contrasting idea will follow
Teachers emphasized proper use of connectives in essay writing
Tendons are connective tissue linking muscles to bones
The surgeon repaired damaged connective tissue in her knee

definitions: state or ability of being connected or interconnected, especially regarding computer networks or systems
examples: The rural area finally received high-speed internet connectivity
Bluetooth connectivity allows wireless pairing with multiple devices

definitions: device or component that joins electrical circuits, cables, or mechanical parts together
examples: The cable connector broke and needed immediate replacement
Different types of connectors link various computer components

definitions: british spelling variant of connection, meaning a link or relationship between things
examples: The old document used 'connexion' throughout the legal text
British writers sometimes prefer connexion to connection

definitions: person with expert knowledge and keen discrimination in matters of taste, especially in arts or cuisine
examples: The wine connoisseur could identify the vineyard by taste alone
Art connoisseurs gathered for the private gallery opening

definitions: idea or feeling that a word invokes in addition to its literal or primary meaning
examples: The word 'childish' has negative connotations unlike 'childlike'
Writers must consider connotations when choosing descriptive words

definitions: act of defeating or overcoming enemies, obstacles, or challenges through force or effort
examples: The conquering of Mount Everest required months of preparation
Her conquering of stage fright took years of practice

definitions: person who defeats and takes control of people, land, or situations through force
examples: William the Conqueror invaded England in 1066
The conquerors imposed their language on the defeated population
